Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='VP87')

BibliographicData.Title: Cingulate cortex of the Rhesus monkey: II. Cortical afferents

BrainSite.FullName: Area 24c (rostral part of the cingulate sulcus)
Temporal parietooccipital associated area in superior temporal sulcus

Reference.Quotation: "...the injcetion involved area 25 below and rostral to the genu of the corpus callosum (Fig. 1)."
"Figure 2 presents a second cingulate case in which the HRP injection was mainly in areas 24a and 24b with slight infringement on areas 24c and 32."
"In a third cingulate case, the injection involved much of area 24, including parts of each subdivision (Fig. 3A)."
"In the fourth case, the injection was placed in the central part of the cingulate gyrus and involved all three divisions of areas 24 and 23 (Fig. 3B)."
"...the injection involved areas 23a, 23b, 30, and 29 (Fig. 4A-F)."
"...the injection involved areas 23a, 23b, 30, and 29...additionally encroached upon adjacent areas 23c and 19 (Fig. 4G)."

TracerSubstance.FullName: Horseradish peroxidase, conjugated to wheat germ agglutinin

Reference.Quotation: "Figure 5 presents a case in which only areas 23a and 23b were involved in the injection (see also Fig. 6A)."

Information on laminar patterns (p. 281): "...the predominant label was over layer I and less was over layers II and III. In these cases there was also substantial label over layer IV." Fig. 11B, however, showa label in infragranular layers also. It remains unclear, whether this label represents terminals or is located in vertically ascending axons. Therefore, the code 322X00 for describing the general laminar pattern was chosen.
